ðŸŒŸ Groovy - a bit of shiny tricks in scripting

  • theory - language specification
  • some snippets in practice

ðŸ¥œ Lifecycle ðŸ¥œ

  • used for programming and scripting ðŸ“Œ with features similar to those of Python or Ruby, what makes it very easy to use non-native groovy idioms ðŸ˜•
  • Groovy source code file can be executed as an (uncompiled) script - what means errors during runtime, it could be also compiled statically, but this is not Jenkins case

ðŸ¥œ (Apache) Groovy in nutshell ðŸ¥œ

  • object-oriented
  • functional
  • java syntax and libraries compatible ðŸ“Œ
  • is able to mix features of dynamically ðŸ“Œ and statically typed language at the same time
  • Groovy implicitly generates getters and setters, and allows to construct object with a field -> value map

ðŸ¥œ Abstract Syntax Tree features: ðŸ¥œ

  • operators overloading and the safe navigation operator ?.
  • native syntax for lists and associative arrays (maps) and closures
  • native support for regular expressions, polymorphic iteration, string interpolation

Jenkins - introduction to pipelines hydrualics

  • ðŸ“Œ Jobs management - how to configure automations on Jenkins
  • Extensions - what are the ways to add missing functionalities
  • Infrastructure - a few words about time/cost optimizations for Jenkins

Job management

  • Freestyle - allows to configure manually set of Jenkins API calls into simple job
  • ðŸ“Œ Pipelines - groovy framework for creating CI/CD pipelines which consits of stages executing steps
  • DSL - way to configure any type of the job via Groovy code instead of manual actions
  • Multibranch - group of jobs generated for set of branches in the specified repository

Extensions

  • Plugins - base part of Jenkins ecosystem, java API provided by plugins is accessible on each part of job config - DSL, freestyle and pipelines
  • ðŸ“Œ Libraries - the best way to add custom steps exposed as JVM libraries into your pipelines
  • UI tweaks - editing jobs HTML is the best way to add business crucial features into jenkins

Infrastructure

  • Manual administration - osx, windows, raspberrys, mobiles
  • ðŸ“Œ CCA VMs - 24⁄7 VMs with tool for codified software management (e.g. puppet/chef)
  • ðŸ“Œ On demand VMs - public cloud computing instances spawned only for the time of job execution
  • ðŸ“Œ Containers - containers attached to jenkins via swarm/k8s/docker cli
  • Serverless - FaaS dispatchment, jenkins X, jenkinsfile runner
